Interface HttpMessageConverters

All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<HttpMessageConverter<?>>
public interface HttpMessageConverters extends Iterable<HttpMessageConverter<?>>
Utility for building and configuring an immutable collection of HttpMessageConverter instances for client or server usage. You can ask to register default converters with classpath detection and override specific converters that were detected. Custom converters can be independently added in front of default ones. Finally, default and custom converters can be configured.
Since:
7.0
Author:
Brian Clozel, Sebastien Deleuze

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Return true if this instance does not contain any message converters.

    • forClient

      static HttpMessageConverters.ClientBuilder forClient()
      Create a builder instance, tailored for HTTP client usage.

      The following HTTP message converters can be detected and registered if available, in order:

      1. All custom message converters configured with the builder
      2. ByteArrayHttpMessageConverter
      3. StringHttpMessageConverter with the StandardCharsets.ISO_8859_1 charset
      4. ResourceHttpMessageConverter, with resource streaming support disabled
      5. a Multipart converter, using all detected and custom converters for part conversion
      6. A Kotlin Serialization JSON converter
      7. A JSON converter
      8. A Smile converter
      9. A Kotlin Serialization CBOR converter
      10. A CBOR converter
      11. A YAML converter
      12. An XML converter
      13. A ProtoBuf converter
      14. ATOM and RSS converters

    • forServer

      static HttpMessageConverters.ServerBuilder forServer()
      Create a builder instance, tailored for HTTP server usage.

      The following HTTP message converters can be detected and registered if available, in order:

      1. All custom message converters configured with the builder
      2. ByteArrayHttpMessageConverter
      3. StringHttpMessageConverter with the StandardCharsets.ISO_8859_1 charset
      4. ResourceHttpMessageConverter
      5. ResourceRegionHttpMessageConverter
      6. A Kotlin Serialization JSON converter
      7. A JSON converter
      8. A Smile converter
      9. A Kotlin Serialization CBOR converter
      10. A CBOR converter
      11. A YAML converter
      12. An XML converter
      13. A ProtoBuf converter
      14. ATOM and RSS converters
      15. a Multipart converter, using all detected and custom converters for part conversion
